long_description: Not just a scaled-down adult pack, the Ace 48 pack from Osprey was designed to fit children's dimensions and proportions-and it grows with them! Fits a variety of backs, thanks to its generous torso-length adjustment: just rip it, adjust it and stick it. Pack is sized to fit kids from approximately 12 to 16 years old. To ensure a healthy and comfortable carry, loaded pack should not be more than 15 to 20 percent of child's body weight. AirScape backpanel features three sections of ridged foam and a central air chimney for increased ventilation. Running down the sidewall, peripheral rods anchor to load-lifter straps and hipbelt, actively transferring load and resisting sag. Top-loading design gives you easy access to the pack's contents; two zippered pockets in removable/extendable lid let you stash maps and small items. Retractable sleeping bag compartment has straps to pull it in from the inside allowing the negative space on the outside for a sleeping bag or pad. ErgoPull hipbelt closure provides extra cinching leverage-drawing tension along top and bottom, not through the center-relieving hipbone pressure. Zippered pockets on hipbelt let you stash small essentials such as a digital camera, snacks, lipbalm and sunblock. Front stretch pocket is ideal for stowing jacket, hat and other often-used essentials. Large stretch-woven side pockets hold your water bottles and organize other small gear items. Hydration-compatible design features reservoir sleeve and a drink tube exit port for on-the-go hydration (reservoir sold separately). Bottom of pack features a small zippered compartment to hold built-in raincover, which is tethered for security. Backpacker April '09 declares that the Osprey Ace 48 "represents a sea change in comfort, features and durability among youth backpacks.".
short_description: Not just a scaled-down adult pack, the Ace 48 pack from Osprey was designed to fit children's dimensions and proportions-and it grows with them!
